general.heading: 0. What‚Äôs the difference between design-only, dev-only, and design + development?
general.title1: Choose design-only if you just need visuals, dev-only if you already have designs, or full-service for a complete concept-to-launch solution.
list: Design-Only: Get Figma files, UX flows, branding, and responsive UI designs, ready for your dev team
Dev-Only: We build your product based on your provided designs, handling code, testing, and launch
Design + Development: End-to-end execution: strategy, design, development, QA, and deployment
general.title2: Example: Building a fintech dashboard from scratch? Full-service is ideal. Already have a design team? Go dev-only.

general.heading: 1. What‚Äôs the difference between hourly and fixed pricing?
general.title1: Hourly is flexible and pay-as-you-go. Fixed is predictable and best for scoped projects.
list: Hourly Pricing: Great for agile workflows and evolving scope. Billed transparently for actual time used.
Fixed Pricing: Ideal for clear, pre-scoped projects. One price, known deliverables, limited changes.
general.title2: Tip: If your features might grow or change, go hourly. For a defined landing page, fixed works best.

general.heading: 2. How long does it take to complete a project?
general.title1: 2‚Äì4 weeks for simple pages, 1‚Äì3 months for apps, 1‚Äì2 months for design systems.
list: Landing Pages or Small Websites: 2‚Äì4 weeks
Web & Mobile Apps: 1‚Äì3 months depending on features
Design Systems: 1‚Äì2 months with component planning + testing
general.title2: Example: A B2B onboarding app with 8 screens typically takes ~6 weeks.

general.heading: 3. Do you offer post-launch support?
general.title1: Yes, we stay with you beyond launch. Every project includes support for fixes and refinements.
list: Bug fixes and minor tweaks (free for X weeks/months)
Option to continue via monthly design/dev retainer
Ongoing consultation for optimization and iterations
general.title2: Tip: Most teams retain us after launch for maintenance and roadmap growth.

general.heading: 4. What‚Äôs included in a typical web or mobile app project?
list: UX strategy & user flows
UI design in Figma
Frontend development (HTML/CSS/React)
Testing & responsive QA
Launch support
general.title2: Deliverables: Design files, codebase, documentation, QA reports.

general.heading: 5. Can I change the scope once we start?
general.title1: Yes, we‚Äôre built for flexibility. Scope changes are common, and we support them without bottlenecks.
list: Scope updates = timeline + pricing adjustments
Additional features can be hourly or added to fixed quote
Clear change logs and approvals before execution
general.title2: Example: You add a new feature mid-project ‚Üí we rescope and move forward.

general.heading: Can I modify my project scope after starting?
general.title1: Yes, we understand that needs can evolve.
list: If you need to add or change features midway, we‚Äôll review the new scope and adjust the timeline and budget accordingly. Our team will work closely with you to keep everything on track while accommodating the changes.
general.title2: üìç Flexibility: Additional features can be billed hourly or added to the fixed budget as an agreed scope extension.

general.heading: 6. How do I choose the right pricing model?
general.title1: If your scope is fixed, choose fixed. If evolving, choose hourly.
list: Fixed Pricing: Best for simple or one-time projects
Hourly Pricing: Ideal for product teams, founders iterating fast
general.title2: Still unsure? Book a call, we‚Äôll recommend the best path.

general.heading: 7. What deliverables do I get with motion graphics?
general.title1: Storyboard + animated video files, optimized for your product.
list: Visual concepts and storyboarding
Lottie-compatible or MP4 formats
Up to 3 rounds of revisions
general.title2: Use case: Animated onboarding, feature explainers, launch videos.

general.heading: 8. Can you set up a Design System and Component Library?
general.title1: Absolutely, that‚Äôs one of our specialties.
list: Design System: Colors, typography, layout rules
Component Library: Buttons, inputs, nav, cards, etc.
Handoff-ready in Figma with documentation

general.heading: 9. What‚Äôs included in a UX Audit & Consultation?
general.title1: A deep review of your current UX with actionable fixes.
list: Friction points, usability issues, design flaws
Live consultation with design recommendations
Prioritized roadmap for improvement
general.title2: Outcome: A documented strategy you can apply instantly.

general.heading: 10. What do you offer in 3D animation and rendering projects?
general.title1: We take your idea from concept to stunning 3D visuals.
list: Storyboarding and scene planning
3D modeling, texturing, lighting
Final renders in requested formats

general.heading: 11. Can you work with my existing designs or wireframes?
general.title1: Yes, we‚Äôre happy to jump in midstream.

Extend existing UI libraries
Turn wireframes into polished flows

general.heading: 12. How do I get started?
general.title1: Simple: Book a consultation or send us your brief, we‚Äôll take it from there.
list: Free consult ‚Üí understand your goals
Proposal within 24‚Äì48 hrs

general.heading: 13. How much does it cost to design a SaaS dashboard in 2025?
general.title1: $900‚Äì$2,000 USD depending on the scope, number of screens, and functionality.
list: MVP Dashboards: ~$900‚Äì$1,100 (6‚Äì8 screens, minimal features, basic UI/UX flows)
Mid-range Dashboards: ~$1,200‚Äì$1,600 (includes charts, auth flows, admin panels, responsive design)
Enterprise Dashboards: up to $2,000+ (advanced states, integrations, data visualizations, role-based access)
general.title2: Need a quote? Contact us with your product scope and we‚Äôll send a custom proposal within 24 hours.

general.heading: 14. What tools and technologies do you use?
general.title1: We use Figma, Webflow, React, Tailwind, Lottie, and After Effects.
list: Figma, Notion, Adobe, After Effects
Webflow, React, HTML/CSS, Framer
Lottie for motion, Storybook for handoff, Git for versioning
general.title2: Ask us for dev handoff examples or UI kit previews.

general.heading: 15. Do you work with startups and founders?
general.title1: Yes, we‚Äôre built for fast-moving startups.
list: MVP packages for lean budgets
Collaborative design sprints
Help with positioning, onboarding, growth UX
general.title2: We‚Äôve worked with 25+ startups across AI, SaaS, fintech, and e-commerce.

general.heading: 16. Do you sign NDAs?
list: We‚Äôre happy to sign your NDA before sharing any details
Or provide ours for convenience
Your product‚Äôs privacy and IP are always protected

general.heading: 17. Do you offer ongoing design support?
list: Monthly retainer plans for startups
Sprint-based support
Design system management & updates

SaaS Web & Mobile Apps.title1: A typical web or mobile app project includes everything you need to launch a user-friendly and polished app:
list: Initial Discovery: We‚Äôll go through your goals, key features, and user journey.
Design & Development: Includes UX/UI design, coding, testing, and feedback rounds.
Launch Support: We‚Äôll assist you through deployment, ensuring the app performs well on all devices.
SaaS Web & Mobile Apps.title2: üìç Deliverables: You‚Äôll receive the full app code, all design assets, documentation, and testing reports.

UX Audits & Consultation.heading: What does a UX Audit & Consultation involve?
UX Audits & Consultation.title1: Our UX audits provide actionable insights to improve your product‚Äôs usability.
list: Audit Report: An in-depth analysis of your product‚Äôs current state, highlighting user pain points and areas for improvement.
Consultation: A discussion to address the findings, offering recommendations tailored to your goals.
Actionable Roadmap: A prioritized list of suggested changes to enhance the user experience.
UX Audits & Consultation.title2: üìç Deliverables: A detailed report, consultation call, and an improvement roadmap, focusing on ease of use and user satisfaction.
